comments: I'll try to reproduce this, but here are the exceptions anyway:

I didn't have a lot of luck in reproducing this, but I know a little bit about 
the circumstances. The steps below should be taken with a pinch of salt:

- created a file.h
- modified it(I think)
- deleted it
- re-created the same file.h
- now I had two files with the same name in the same spot which both where 
unsaved

?yvind

Mikhailk, could you look at the two exceptions generated by the debug:
see below,  I do beleive that you catch (1) now in the trunk, but
(2) is new to me.  We should make another PR for the debug ones.

The problem with the save comes from SourceManipulation,  I will Cc Hoda
on this, I think she's back from vacation ..(or maybe not).

(1)
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.cdi.MI2CDIException: {R,T}xThread terminated
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.cdi.BreakpointManager.deleteBreakpoints(BreakpointManager.java:341)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.core.model.CDebugTarget.removeAllBreakpoints(CDebugTarget.java:1242)

(2)

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at

	at

This was fix in the Head
